2017 WW19 Purley Crystal Ridge BKC Release Announcement (\n BKC #7)

\n \n \n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\n \n
\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2017 WW19 Purley Crystal Ridge BKC release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\n \n Fedora25/\n \n WS2016\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Bei, Ling.

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server
Fedora25WithoutOS_BKC-CrystalRidge_FC25_100.119784.119823-2017WW19.zip\n \n
FC25x86_64.zip\n 		WithoutOS_BKC-CrystalRidge_FC25_100.119784.119823-2017WW19.zip\n \n
FC25x86_64.zip\n
WS2016WithoutOS_BKC-CrystalRidge_Win2016_67.119851.119805-2017WW19.zip\n \n
win2016_RS1_14393.zip\n 		WithoutOS_BKC-CrystalRidge_Win2016_67.119851.119805-2017WW19.zip\n \n
win2016_RS1_14393.zip\n
\n

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

\n
\n\n
\n
\n   Summary \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n

 Test\nResult:

Finish AEP test execution on 2-2-2, 2-1-1 and 1-1-1 config.

Refer to the installation guide BKC\npackage installation

Total test case 35; Passed test case\nis: 34 and pass rate is 97% 

       

       Note:  Please do\nAEP format under UEFI after CR FW 3769  is updated (Not needed for\nnext CR FW)

1.    Boot to UEFI shell

2.    unload\nrelease UEFI driver in build-in IFWI and reload the debug UEFI drivers in 01.00.01.1853

unload ApachePassDriver.efi

unload ApachePassHii.efi

load ApachePassDriver.efi

3.    ApachepassCli.efi\nstart -format -dimm

4.    Reboot\nthe system.

 

ES1 AEP DIMM Setup BKM 

\xc2\xb7        Update\nCR FW

If AEP DIMM is not\nhealthy, we\nhave two alternatives:

a.      Do AEP format

           \n1. Attach ITP to the SKX XDP port

           \n2. On the ElkValley pythonSV console, type below commands for DIMM formatting

           \n>>>itp.cv.resetbreak=1

           \n>>> sv.refresh()

           \n>>> fw.showBSR()

      \n     >>>import falconvalley.fw.fnvFwFunctions\nas fw

           \n>>>fw.dfxFormat(unlockDimm=False)

           \n>>>itp.cv.resetbreak=0

           \n3. Power cycle the system

           \n4. Boot to UEFI shell and update CR

              \nApachePassCli.efi load -f \xe2\x80\x93source  .\\< _strip.bin fw file> -dimm

b.     If step a is not working, use ITP/Jtag to update AEP FW and Syn SPD one by one, follow the\nBKM Setup_TAB_AEP_BKM_v1.1.docx

 

If AEP DIMM is health, use UEFI shell to update all AEP FW

               ApachePassCli.efi load\n\xe2\x80\x93f -source <path_to_strip.bin> - dimm

 \xc2\xb7     Goal/namespace can be created under\nUEFI or Linux

a.          UEFI:\nApachePassCli.efi create -f -goal PersistentMemoryType=AppDirect

                 ApachePassCli.efi\nshow -a \xe2\x80\x93pool

         \n       ApachePassCli.efi create \xe2\x80\x93namespace\n\xe2\x80\x93pool <pool_Id> Type=AppDirect

b.        \n Linux: ixpdimm-cli create \xe2\x80\x93f \xe2\x80\x93goal\npersistentmemorytype=appdirect

                   ixpdimm-\ncli show -a \xe2\x80\x93pool

                   ixpdimm-cli\ncreate \xe2\x80\x93namespace \xe2\x80\x93pool <pool_Id> Type=AppDirect

\xc2\xb7       \nSetting\nthe following knobs is required to boot CR System:

\n   HW Rework \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n
\n

Pedigree and Board Jumper Settings: 2S Guide

Note: Only mandatory and necessary optional rework is implemented by BKC team

\xc2\xb7      2s

o NC_RWK_I (Mandatory): Update BMC FW

o NC_RWK_K (Mandatory): Avoiding false LAN Wake Activations

o NC_RWK_L (Mandatory): Update CPLD FW

o NC_RWK_M (Mandatory): No-Boot without ITP issue fix

o Note: In case you have implemented Optional rework 20, you should move switch S4E2.4 to OFF position, otherwise the default position is ON.

Notes: To subscribe or unsubscribe to the mailing list please click here and select "Purley CrystalRidge Subscription".

InformationQuick Guide
BKC Artifactory Access

Link (SH server): https://ubit-artifactory-sh.intel.com

Link (OR server): https://ubit-artifactory-or.intel.com

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=757719
  • Apply for the "Project viewer" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

BKC One Stop Shop

Link: https://dcg-oss.intel.com/homepage_view/24/

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=829001
  • Navigate to:"BKC -- Purley"
  • Apply for the "User" or "Ingredient Owner" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

Contact Person: Bei, Ling
